intro: Lychnis attenuata f. glabra, commonly known as the smooth garden pink, is a variant of the garden pink species native to Europe. It is a herbaceous perennial characterized by its upright, branching stems and clusters of pink to reddish-purple flowers. The plant features smooth, glabrous (hairless) leaves and stems, distinguishing it from other forms of Lychnis attenuata. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and blooms in late spring to early summer. This cultivar is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in gardens for its vibrant flowers and compact growth habit.
